pattern.title: Energy Leak at Lead Knee
pattern.description: Your lead knee is flexed at 0.3° (should be 160-180°). This absorbs 99.8% of your ground force before it reaches your hips. Result: Weak hip contribution (2.10 vs target 8-10+) and shoulder compensation (8.68x vs target 0.7-1.5x).
pattern.root_cause: Coordination issue - lead knee flexing instead of extending

drills.name: Single-Leg Isometric Holds
drills.description: Stand on lead leg, knee at 160-170°. Push through ball of foot, engage quad + glute.
drills.progression: Increase hold time to 30s by Week 2

drills.name: Single-Leg Vertical Jumps
drills.cue: Lock it on landing, don't collapse
drills.description: Jump vertically off lead leg only. Land with knee 160-180° (stiff landing). Stick landing 2 seconds.
drills.progression: Increase jump height and landing control

drills.name: Wall Knee Extension Drill
drills.description: Back against wall, lead foot 12" forward. Push through ball of foot → extend knee. Feel quad + glute activate simultaneously.

weeks.validation_test: Video swing analysis - measure lead knee angle at contact

drills.name: Force Pedals (Soft)
drills.cue: Feel the bounce, push through it
drills.description: Soft hexagonal foam platform under ball of lead foot. Start with dry swings, progress to tee work.
drills.progression: Week 3: Dry swings, Week 4: Tee work

drills.name: Lead Leg Slam → Swing
drills.description: Stand on lead leg. SLAM foot down (vertical push). Immediately load and swing. Feel hip decelerate after slam.
drills.progression: Add resistance band for added force

drills.name: Medicine Ball Rotational Throws
drills.description: Simulate swing motion with 8-10lb med ball. Focus: Hip stops → Torso continues → Ball releases. Feel hip deceleration create stretch.

weeks.validation_test: Track hip angular momentum in follow-up analysis

drills.name: Force Pedals + Soft Toss (Firm)
drills.description: Firm pedal under lead foot. Live ball contact (soft toss from front). Focus: Vertical push → Extension → Whip.

drills.name: Dr. Kwon Rope Swings
drills.description: Rope attached to bat handle (3-4 feet). Swing rope → forces sequential acceleration. Feel 'lag' (rope lags behind body rotation).

drills.name: Constraint Soft Toss
drills.description: Ball placed at contact point on tee. Must extend lead arm to reach ball. Can't pull across (ball will be missed).
drills.progression: Move to front toss, then live BP

weeks.expected_change: Pattern transfers to live swings, ball outcomes improve
weeks.downstream_effect: Exit velo 82 → 88-91 mph, Launch angle 2° → 12-18°, GB% 65% → 35%
weeks.validation_test: Game stats tracking - exit velo, launch angle, batted ball distribution

coach_take:
Your ground forces and timing are elite. But here's the issue: your lead leg isn't extending through the pitch plane — it's only at 0.3° (needs to be 160-180°). This causes you to pull the bat across instead of extending through, forcing your shoulders to over-rotate (8.68x, should be 0.7-1.5x).

The result? A drag pattern with zero late whip, losing 5-9 mph and causing you to roll over breaking balls.

**The Fix:** Teach your front leg to LOCK and create vertical bounce. We'll use single-leg jumps to train your lead knee extension, Force Pedals to create vertical ground force, and rope swings to restore your bat whip.

**Expected Results (6 weeks):**
• Exit Velo: 82 → 89 mph (+7 mph)
• Launch Angle: 2° → 15° (ground balls → line drives)
• Breaking Ball AVG: .180 → .280
• Hip Contribution: 2.1 → 8-10+ angular momentum
• Line Drive Rate: 25% → 55%

You have all the ingredients. Now we just need to fix the knee leak so your hips can do their job.
